summary: I. PROGRAM DESCRIPTIONThe Democratic Republic of Congo is among the 7 African countries affected by the epidemic of EBOLA, the latter reappears for the 7th time in the DRC. For this last reappearance, the EBOLA outbreak lives in the only province of Ecuador to LOKULI in the territory of BOENDE, where it is in the control phase as indicated by the Government through the Ministry of health. At present, 58 people are suspected to be infected with the disease, 185 people who were in contact with these patients are monitored, and 31 have died.In this context, the Ministry of Health conducts preventive awareness campaigns against the epidemic, to block its progress to other provinces, including the province of Kinshasa which is the capital.
